concept.title: Avoid inserts in autocommit mode if possible

conbody.p:
Inserts can be painfully slow in autocommit mode because each commit involves an update of the log on the disk for each INSERT statement. The commit will not return until a physical disk write is executed. To speed things up:
Run in autocommit false mode, execute a number of inserts in one transaction, and then explicitly issue a commit.
If your application allows an initial load into the table, you can use the import procedures to insert data into a table. will not log the individual inserts when loading into an empty table using these interfaces. See the and the for more information on the import procedures.
